snippet.title: Reef unleashes at pro junior event in California
snippet.content: SURFING: Young gun Reef Heazlewood has further proved his potential with some eye-catching performances at a pro junior event in California. The Moffat Beach teen stormed into the semi-finals at the Vans US Open of Surfiing at Huntington Beach, by winning a four-surfer quarter-final. The Australia/Oceania pro junior title holder claimed a two-wave total of 13.50 to finish ahead of American John Mel, who had the wave of the day. "I was having a lot of fun out there and I'm stoked to win that heat," Heazlewood said. "I've got a great a support system here with my girlfriend Summer (Macedo), mom, as well as my team manager, so it's a good crew and means a lot to have them all here," he told World Surf League." Heazlewood, who was due to surf in the latter stages of the competition on Friday night, has competed in some open men's Qualifying Series events this year and will look to ramp things up on that circuit in 2018. "It's been grindy, but I'm enjoying it. It's such a good experience and looking forward to what happens next year on the QS," he said He's also due to compete at the world junior championships at Kiama in February. The pro junior competition at Huntington is among a host of surfing events running concurrently events there. The words "hustler!" and "bitch!" were hurled.
